basic_info.name: Maruti Suzuki XL6
basic_info.description: Maruti Suzuki XL6 is a 6-seater MUV available at a starting price of Rs. 11.52 Lakh. The car is available in 9 variants, with 2 engine and 2 transmission option. Additionally, XL6 offers a Ground Clearance measurement of 180 mm and a Boot capacity of 209 liters. You can choose from 9 colors for the XL6. The mileage of the XL6 varies from 20.3 - 26 KM/L depending on the model.

colors: Splendid Silver With Midnight Black Roof
Brave Khaki With Midnight Black Roof
Opulent Red With Midnight Black Roof

Introduction: The latest iteration of the Maruti XL6 was launched in July 2025 with new upgrades.
The XL6 is a six-seater MPV yet known for its stylish SUV-inspired design.
The upgraded XL6 features a comfortable interior and fuel-efficient powertrain options.
The XL6 is a popular choice for families seeking a versatile and attractive vehicle.
Exterior: In the front, the LED reflector headlamps have integrated DRLs (Daytime Running Lights).
A large front grille with sweeping X-bar chrome accents is its characterising factor.
The XL6’s body features black cladding along the sides and around the wheel arches.
This has also been complemented by roof rails that reinforce its SUV-inspired styling.
Lastly, the MPV rides on 16-inch dual-tone machined finish alloy wheels, which enhance the XL6’s stance.
Interior: Inside, the XL6 has an all-black cabin with a focus on simplicity yet with premium touches.
The dashboard is split by a black AC vent panel with a large black and grey panel below.
Its dashboard is also highlighted by silver accents and stone finish surfaces.
The XL6 features leatherette upholstery for its seats and soft touch padding on the door pads.
The cabin feels spacious due to the large glass area and a lowered dashboard position.
Front seats are large and comfortable for long journeys, while the second row consists of plush leatherette captain seats.
The XL6’s third row provides recline functionality.
Powertrain: The 2025 XL6 is powered by a 1.5-litre Smart Hybrid petrol engine.
It delivers 102bhp of power and 137Nm of torque.
There is also a CNG variant that is rated at 87bhp and 121Nm of torque.
Transmission options include a five-speed manual and a six-speed automatic transmission.
The claimed fuel economy for the petrol model is 20.27kmpl and 26.32km/kg for the CNG variant.

verdict: The XL6 is a welcome addition to the Maruti Suzuki family. Could it have been better? Yes. But it is still a car I see plenty of families and individuals adopting. The pricing is fairly attractive sitting just a bit higher than the Ertiga's but with a good chunk of equipment as standard. It may not be as big as the Innova, and perhaps remains a tad lower on premiumness. But its ride quality and feature list, plus its styling and pricing will get people in to check out Nexa's first 3-row car.
